Authors: Lamiya Abasova, Dilzara Aghayeva, Susumu Takamatsu
Title:
Erysiphe azerbaijanica and E. linderae: two new powdery
mildew species (Erysiphales) belonging to the Microsphaera lineage of
Erysiphe.
Abstract:
Two new species, Erysiphe azerbaijanica on Castanea sativa
and E. linderae on Lindera praecox, both belonging to the Microsphara
lineage of the genus Erysiphe are described based on morphological and
molecular data. Erysiphe azerbaijanica is distinguished from other
Erysiphe species reported on Castanea spp. based on the cylindrical
conidia with length/width ratio 2Â–3.6 and its longer foot cells.
Molecular analysis indicated that this species forms a clade of its own,
supporting the morphological observations. Molecular phylogenetic
analyses showed that E. blasti is divided into two different groups by
its host species. Based on the observations of the holotype and the
differences in numbers and length of appendages, the fungus on L.
praecox was described as a new species, E. linderae.
